## Description {#details}

X86&#95;64 support for SysV ABI (Linux, MacOSX).

X86&#95;64&#95;SysV supports lazy JITing.

Definition at line 158 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h">OrcABISupport.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### writeResolverCode() {#ac5e54c6d22c5d35f3dced631e08b8fa1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::OrcX86&#95;64&#95;SysV::writeResolverCode (char &#42; ResolverWorkingMem, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ResolverTargetAddress, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ReentryFnAddr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ReentryCtxAddr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Write the resolver code into the given memory.

The user is responsible for allocating the memory and setting permissions.

ReentryFnAddr should be the address of a function whose signature matches void&#42; (&#42;)(void &#42;TrampolineAddr, void &#42;ReentryCtxAddr). The ReentryCtxAddr argument of writeResolverCode will be passed as the second argument to the function at ReentryFnAddr.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h">OrcABISupport.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp/#l00253">253</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp">OrcABISupport.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
